page.title: 08HOUSING.
page.content: There is a small amount of housing development in Southwold but Reydon has to cope with most of the pressure of population. There are{10_15 dwellings per acre in the area. Southwold contains many large houses of varied age and many have been sub_divided into flats. There are{149 council houses. There is a lack of developable land in Southwold; most of it is designated as Conservation area. Housing stock in Reydon has increased from{730}to{1009}in the last 4 years. The average house has 3 bedrooms and is semi_detached. There are{229 council houses.{7 acres}of land are proposed for development. There is sheltered accomodation in both Reydon and Southwold and an old people's home called{Hillfield}in Reydon.
